algorithm_technique: Sort the array and iterate from the largest elements, checking the triangle inequality.
problem_summary_simple: Find the largest perimeter of a triangle formed by three side lengths from an array.
problem_summary_technical: Sort the side lengths and greedily check triplets from largest to smallest for the triangle inequality.
key_insights: To maximize the perimeter, we should consider the largest possible side lengths.
The triangle inequality states that the sum of any two sides must be greater than the third side.
Sorting the array allows us to efficiently check this condition by iterating from the largest elements.
